page.title: 10Duke of Norfolk's School
page.content: { The Duke of Norfolk's School}is one of the oldest schools in Glossop. It is a small primary school divided into two parts on different sites. The {Infant School}is based at the original site in {Old Glossop.}There is a half mile distance between the two sites. The{Junior School}is at the{ {Royle Annexe Site.}The children here are between 6 to 11 years old. There are 6 teachers and 180 children. This is the newest part of the school started in 1958 when it only consisted of the hall and kitchen. It has, of course been added to since. The children stay inside for lunch and can either have a set meal prepared by the school or can bring sandwiches.
